name: Dhebra
history: Dhebra is a popular snack from the Gujarati cuisine, known for its nutritious value as it is made using millet flour and fresh fenugreek leaves.
description: Dhebra is a type of Indian bread similar to paratha, made from millet flour (bajra) mixed with fresh fenugreek leaves (methi), spices, and yogurt. It's typically enjoyed as a tea-time snack or for breakfast.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine bajra flour, chopped fenugreek leaves, yogurt, green chili paste, ginger paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and salt. Gradually add water and knead to form a soft dough.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Dhebras
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Flatten each ball and roll it into a circle using a rolling pin. Heat a griddle or tawa and cook each dhebra with a little oil until it turns golden brown on both sides.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the dhebras hot with chutney, yogurt, or pickles. They can also be enjoyed with a cup of tea.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for the best results.
Adjust the amount of green chili and spices as per your taste.
variations: Add grated vegetables like carrot or cabbage for a nutritious twist.
Experiment with different leafy greens like spinach or kale instead of fenugreek leaves.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh, but can be stored for up to a day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a tawa or in a microwave for a few seconds until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a traditional Indian thali along with other Gujarati dishes.
Garnish with a side of fresh salad or lemon wedges.
